statement: If ax^2 + bx + c = 0 and b^2 - 4ac > 0, then the equation has two distinct real roots.
If b^2 - 4ac = 0, then the quadratic equation has one real repeated root.
If b^2 - 4ac < 0, then the quadratic equation has two complex conjugate roots.
To solve a quadratic equation by completing the square, isolate the quadratic and linear terms, add the square of half the coefficient of x, and factor.
If x^n = x^m, and x ≠ 0, then n = m.
The logarithmic identity log_b(xy) = log_b(x) + log_b(y) can be used to simplify or expand expressions.
The inverse of a function swaps the input and output: if f(x) = y, then f⁻¹(y) = x.
To find the inverse of a function, solve the equation y = f(x) for x, then interchange x and y.
A rational expression is undefined when the denominator equals zero.
The sum of a geometric series with ratio r ≠ 1 is a(1 - r^n)/(1 - r).
The complex conjugate of a + bi is a - bi.
To multiply two complex numbers, use distributive property and simplify using i^2 = -1.
The inverse of a 2×2 matrix A = [[a, b], [c, d]] exists if ad - bc ≠ 0 and is given by (1/(ad-bc))·[[d, -b], [-c, a]].
If f(x) is a polynomial and f(c) = 0, then (x - c) is a factor of f(x).
The Remainder Theorem states that the remainder of f(x) divided by (x - c) is f(c).
To determine whether a function is even, check whether f(-x) = f(x) for all x in the domain.
To determine whether a function is odd, check whether f(-x) = -f(x) for all x in the domain.
If a > b and b > c, then a > c. (Transitive Property of Inequality)
Absolute value equations |x| = a split into two cases: x = a or x = -a.
Exponential functions have the form f(x) = a·b^x, where a ≠ 0 and b > 0, b ≠ 1.
To solve an exponential equation a^x = a^y, equate the exponents: x = y.
log_b(xy) = log_b(x) + log_b(y) for all x, y > 0 and b > 0, b ≠ 1.
log_b(x/y) = log_b(x) - log_b(y) for all x, y > 0 and b > 0, b ≠ 1.
log_b(x^r) = r·log_b(x) for all x > 0 and b > 0, b ≠ 1.
The composition of functions f(g(x)) applies g first, then f.
Two functions f and g are inverses if f(g(x)) = x and g(f(x)) = x for all x in the domain.
Vertical asymptotes of rational functions occur where the denominator is zero and the numerator is non-zero.
The absolute value of a complex number a + bi is √(a² + b²).
To shift a graph horizontally, replace x with x - h inside the function.
To shift a graph vertically, add or subtract a constant outside the function.
The nth term of an arithmetic sequence is given by a_n = a_1 + (n - 1)d.
The sum of the first n terms of an arithmetic sequence is S_n = n(a_1 + a_n)/2.
The nth term of a geometric sequence is a_n = a_1 · r^(n - 1).
The sum of the first n terms of a geometric sequence is S_n = a_1(1 - r^n)/(1 - r) for r ≠ 1.
The sum of an infinite geometric series is S = a_1 / (1 - r) for |r| < 1.
The Binomial Theorem expands (a + b)^n using binomial coefficients: Σ[k=0 to n] C(n, k) · a^{n-k} · b^k.
The matrix product AB is defined when the number of columns of A equals the number of rows of B.
The identity matrix I satisfies AI = IA = A for any matrix A.
A matrix A has an inverse A⁻¹ if and only if det(A) ≠ 0.
The determinant of a 2x2 matrix [[a, b], [c, d]] is ad - bc.
To solve a system using matrices, write as AX = B and compute X = A⁻¹B, if A is invertible.
Matrix multiplication corresponds to linear transformation composition.
A complex number can be written as a + bi where a and b are real, and i² = -1.
To multiply complex numbers, apply distributive property and simplify using i² = -1.
To rationalize a denominator with a complex number, multiply numerator and denominator by the conjugate.
The domain of a function excludes values that cause division by zero or even roots of negative numbers.
The inverse of a function f(x) satisfies f(f⁻¹(x)) = x and f⁻¹(f(x)) = x.
A function has an inverse if and only if it is one-to-one.
Logarithms are the inverses of exponential functions: if y = log_b(x), then b^y = x.
Logarithm product rule: log_b(xy) = log_b(x) + log_b(y).
Logarithm quotient rule: log_b(x/y) = log_b(x) - log_b(y).
Logarithm power rule: log_b(x^r) = r·log_b(x).
To solve exponential equations, rewrite both sides with the same base or apply logarithms.
The domain of a square root function f(x) = √(g(x)) includes only values of x such that g(x) ≥ 0.
To solve equations involving square roots, isolate the root term and square both sides.
Squaring both sides of an equation may introduce extraneous solutions, so all solutions must be checked in the original equation.
The graph of y = √(x - h) + k is the graph of y = √x shifted h units right and k units up.
The domain of a rational function f(x) = p(x)/q(x) excludes values of x where q(x) = 0.
Vertical asymptotes occur at values of x where the denominator of a rational function equals zero and the numerator is nonzero.
A hole in the graph of a rational function occurs where both numerator and denominator have a common factor that cancels out.
Horizontal asymptotes are determined by comparing the degrees of the numerator and denominator polynomials.
To add or subtract rational expressions, find a common denominator and combine numerators.
To solve rational equations, multiply both sides by the least common denominator and check for extraneous solutions.
The expression |x| is defined as x if x ≥ 0 and –x if x < 0.
To solve an equation of the form |A(x)| = B, consider both cases: A(x) = B and A(x) = –B.
The graph of y = |x – h| + k is a V-shape shifted h units right and k units up.
A piecewise function is defined by different expressions on different intervals of its domain.
To evaluate a piecewise function at a specific input, determine which interval the input falls into.
To graph a piecewise function, graph each piece only on its defined interval.
A system involving nonlinear equations can have zero, one, or multiple solutions depending on the points of intersection.
To solve a system with a linear and a nonlinear equation algebraically, substitute the expression for one variable into the other equation.
A function is discontinuous at x = a if the limit from the left does not equal the limit from the right, or the value of the function does not match the limit.
A jump discontinuity occurs in a graph when the left- and right-hand limits exist but are not equal.
An exponential function has the form f(x) = a·b^x where a ≠ 0 and b > 0, b ≠ 1.
If 0 < b < 1, then f(x) = a·b^x is a decreasing exponential function.
If b > 1, then f(x) = a·b^x is an increasing exponential function.
To solve an exponential equation b^x = b^y, equate the exponents: x = y.
The logarithmic function log_b(x) is the inverse of the exponential function b^x.
log_b(x) = y is equivalent to b^y = x.
The domain of log_b(x) is x > 0.
The graph of y = log_b(x) passes through (1, 0) and has a vertical asymptote at x = 0.
The logarithmic properties include: log_b(M·N) = log_b(M) + log_b(N), log_b(M/N) = log_b(M) – log_b(N), and log_b(M^k) = k·log_b(M).
To solve logarithmic equations, isolate the log expression and convert to exponential form.
A radical function is a function that includes a variable inside a root expression, such as f(x) = √(x – a) or f(x) = ∛(x + b).
The domain of a square root function f(x) = √(expression) consists of all x-values that make the expression under the square root greater than or equal to zero.
When solving radical equations, isolate the radical and square both sides carefully, then check for extraneous solutions.
A rational function is any function that can be written as the ratio of two polynomials.
The domain of a rational function excludes values that make the denominator zero.
Vertical asymptotes of a rational function occur at values of x that make the denominator zero but not the numerator.
Holes in the graph of a rational function occur when both the numerator and denominator share a common factor that becomes zero at a particular x-value.
To simplify a rational expression, factor both the numerator and denominator and cancel any common factors.
To solve rational equations, find a common denominator or use cross-multiplication, then solve and check for extraneous solutions.
